findings.description: REQ-0007 (Measurable throughput and quality gains) has empty evidence_ids. All three council subagents unanimously confirmed this finding. The requirement claims measurability but provides no evidence artifacts to verify the acceptance criteria.
findings.remediation: Create evidence artifacts EVID-0013 (PR cycle time measurement) and EVID-0014 (defect recurrence tracking). Link these to REQ-0007 evidence_ids.

findings.description: MET-0006 (PR cycle time) and MET-0007 (Defect recurrence rate) have empty evidence_ids. These metrics are key success indicators but lack defined evidence artifacts for baseline or post-adoption measurement.
findings.remediation: Create EVID-0013 and EVID-0014 with: baseline capture commands, comparison methodology, statistical significance thresholds, confounder controls.

findings.description: Success metrics use aspirational language ('monotonic decrease toward zero', 'increase toward 99%+') without quantified thresholds, timelines, or confidence intervals. All three subagents identified this as a fundamental verifiability gap.
findings.remediation: Replace with quantified targets: MET-0001 should specify 'â‰¥20% decrease MoM, <5 per 1000 work items within 6 months'; MET-0002 should specify '95% within 3 months, 99% within 12 months'. Add 80% confidence intervals.

findings.description: Escalation mechanism for pack misses is undefined. AC-0003-04 states 'Pack misses fail runs by default unless escalated' but does not define: who can authorize escalation, what conditions allow it, how it is recorded, when it expires, or how escalation frequency feeds back to pack improvement.
findings.remediation: Define EscalationPolicy artifact with authority_role, escalation_criteria, escalation_ttl, audit_event_type, and escalation_count_metric.

findings.description: RSK-0002 (schema strictness) and RSK-0004 (consumption hermeticity) represent the same fundamental tradeoff (strictness vs. velocity) but are analyzed independently without unified criteria weighting. SA-2 proposed severity upgrade from MINOR to MAJOR based on adoption risk.
findings.remediation: Create unified tradeoff analysis with explicit criteria ranking, quantified thresholds ('accept X% velocity reduction for Y% security'), Pareto frontier showing configurations, and coordinated mitigation strategy.

findings.description: G-0003 states discretionary context discovery is 'denied' while G-0007 states unplanned tool calls 'trend toward zero'. If denied, the count should be zero; if trending, there must be allowed violations. These goals express conflicting enforcement models.
findings.remediation: Choose one model: (A) Strict - G-0007 says 'reaches zero upon full enforcement', or (B) Graduated - G-0003 says 'defect-emitting initially, transitioning to denied after stabilization'. Apply consistently.

findings.description: The defect-to-improvement feedback loop is conceptually present but operationally underspecified. No explicit mechanism defines how DefectRecords aggregate, when pack specifications are reviewed, or what feedback latency SLA applies.
findings.remediation: Add explicit feedback mechanism: DefectRecord aggregation trigger conditions, pack specification review cadence, feedback latency SLA, and metric for pack spec evolution rate.

findings.description: Bootstrap verification failure 'requires binary update' per GRD-0001, but no recovery path is defined for the deadlock scenario where neither old nor new binary can operate due to ledger/bootstrap incompatibility.
findings.remediation: Add recovery procedure: bootstrap-safe mode (read-only diagnosis), ledger compatibility check before upgrade, rollback compatibility matrix, emergency override with dual-signoff.

findings.description: The abductive inference from failure modes to CAC as the solution does not explicitly rule out simpler alternatives. For each failure mode, alternative interventions could address the symptoms.
findings.remediation: For each failure mode, list 2-3 alternative interventions and explain why CAC is superior. Document the 'YAGNI test' - which CAC features could be deferred if simpler interventions partially succeed.

findings.description: Dependency trust boundary attack vector: An adversary can inject malicious content via stable_id resolution timing. Pack specs referencing stable_ids resolve to latest hash at compilation time, which may have changed since pack spec was reviewed.
findings.remediation: Pack specs referencing stable_ids MUST capture resolved hashes at review time. Compilation MUST warn/fail if resolved hash differs from reviewed hash. Add 'dependency_review_hash' field in pack spec.

strategic_recommendations.recommendation: Close the feedback loop by defining explicit DefectRecord aggregation and pack specification evolution mechanism
Add falsifiable predictions for metrics with quantified thresholds and statistical tests
Add explicit ROI model quantifying productivity gains and adoption costs
Consider ecosystem growth strategy for target profile sharing with partners

verdict_reason: Council reached consensus with 10 findings (8 MAJOR, 2 MINOR). All required angles executed across 3 subagents with 15 unique reasoning modes. Quorum achieved on all contested findings. No BLOCKER findings identified. PRD is fundamentally sound but requires remediation of MAJOR findings before RFC transition.
